title: How to Make Gluten Free Apple Buckwheat Cereal

steps.headline: Combine the buckwheat groats, almond milk, cinnamon stick, nutmeg and salt in a saucepan.
Bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat.
Continue to boil for about 20 minutes, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon to break down the starches and give the buckwheat a stickier texture.
steps.description: As you stir, scrape the sides and the bottom of the pot so that the cereal doesn’t stick to the pot and burn.

steps.headline: Add the apples and cook for an additional 10 minutes until the apples have softened.
Remove the cereal from the heat and spoon the cereal into bowls.
Pour extra almond milk onto the cereal to cool it or to thin it, as desired.

text: Combine the buckwheat groats, almond milk, cinnamon stick, nutmeg and salt in a saucepan.  Bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat.  Continue to boil for about 20 minutes, stirring frequently with a wooden spoon to break down the starches and give the buckwheat a stickier texture. As you stir, scrape the sides and the bottom of the pot so that the cereal doesn’t stick to the pot and burn. Add the apples and cook for an additional 10 minutes until the apples have softened.  Discard the cinnamon stick.  Remove the cereal from the heat and spoon the cereal into bowls.  Drizzle it with maple syrup.  Pour extra almond milk onto the cereal to cool it or to thin it, as desired.
